parts.text: What is a minor second?

A minor second is the smallest interval in Western music.
The [MIDI:60@0-1.0:root note]
the [MIDI:61@0-1.0:note one half step above]
Together they create the [MIDI:60@0-1.0,61@0-1.0:minor second]
This tight interval creates strong dissonance.
What is a major second?

A major second is an interval of two half steps.
The [MIDI:60@0-1.0:root note]
the [MIDI:62@0-1.0:note two half steps above]
Together they create the [MIDI:60@0-1.0,62@0-1.0:major second]
This is the basic step in a major scale.
What is a minor third?

A minor third is an interval of three half steps.
The [MIDI:60@0-1.0:root note]
the [MIDI:63@0-1.0:note three half steps above]
Together they create the [MIDI:60@0-1.0,63@0-1.0:minor third]
This interval gives minor chords their characteristic sound.
What is a perfect fourth?

A perfect fourth is an interval of five half steps.
The [MIDI:60@0-1.0:root note]
the [MIDI:65@0-1.0:note five half steps above]
Together they create the [MIDI:60@0-1.0,65@0-1.0:perfect fourth]
This interval has a strong, stable quality.
What is a tritone?

A tritone is an interval of six half steps.
The [MIDI:60@0-1.0:root note]
the [MIDI:66@0-1.0:note six half steps above]
Together they create the [MIDI:60@0-1.0,66@0-1.0:tritone]
This unstable interval creates maximum tension.
What is a perfect fifth?

A perfect fifth is an interval of seven half steps.
The [MIDI:60@0-1.0:root note]
the [MIDI:67@0-1.0:note seven half steps above]
Together they create the [MIDI:60@0-1.0,67@0-1.0:perfect fifth]
This is one of the most stable intervals in music.
What is a minor sixth?

A minor sixth is an interval of eight half steps.
The [MIDI:60@0-1.0:root note]
the [MIDI:68@0-1.0:note eight half steps above]
Together they create the [MIDI:60@0-1.0,68@0-1.0:minor sixth]
This interval has a distinctive, reaching quality.
What is a major sixth?

A major sixth is an interval of nine half steps.
The [MIDI:60@0-1.0:root note]
the [MIDI:69@0-1.0:note nine half steps above]
Together they create the [MIDI:60@0-1.0,69@0-1.0:major sixth]
This warm interval is common in many melodies.
What is a minor seventh?

A minor seventh is an interval of ten half steps.
The [MIDI:60@0-1.0:root note]
the [MIDI:70@0-1.0:note ten half steps above]
Together they create the [MIDI:60@0-1.0,70@0-1.0:minor seventh]
This interval adds tension and color to chords.
What is a major seventh?

A major seventh is an interval of eleven half steps.
The [MIDI:60@0-1.0:root note]
the [MIDI:71@0-1.0:note eleven half steps above]
Together they create the [MIDI:60@0-1.0,71@0-1.0:major seventh]
This interval creates an unresolved, complex sound.
What is an octave?

An octave is an interval of twelve half steps.
The [MIDI:60@0-1.0:root note]
the [MIDI:72@0-1.0:same note an octave higher]
Together they create the [MIDI:60@0-1.0,72@0-1.0:octave]
These notes have the same pitch class at different frequencies.
